methods.name: bigquery
title: Google
Cloud#bigquery
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the BigQuery service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"
table.data.each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigquery

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 5. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default request timeout in seconds. Optional.

methods.name: bigquery
title: Google
Cloud.bigquery
methods.description:
Creates a new Project instance connected to the BigQuery service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

bigquery = Google::Cloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Identifier for a BigQuery project. If not
present, the default project for the credentials is used.

params.name: credentials
params.description: The path to the keyfile as a String, the contents of the keyfile as a Hash, or a Google::Auth::Credentials object. (See Bigquery::Credentials)

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigquery

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 5. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: new
title: Google
Cloud.new
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to Google Cloud.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore
pubsub  = gcloud.pubsub
storage = gcloud.storage

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Project identifier for the service you are
connecting to.

params.name: credentials
params.description:
The path to
the keyfile as a String, the contents of the keyfile as a Hash, or a
Google::Auth::Credentials object.

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 3. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: datastore
title: Google
Cloud#datastore
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Datastore service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore

task = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

datastore.save task

examples.caption: You shouldnâ€™t need to override the default scope, but you can:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
datastore = gcloud.datastore scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/datastore

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. See Google::Gax::CallSettings. Optional.

methods.name: datastore
title: Google
Cloud.datastore
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Datastore service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

datastore = Google::Cloud.datastore "my-todo-project",
                                    "/path/to/keyfile.json"

task = datastore.entity "Task", "sampleTask" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

datastore.save task

params.name: project
params.description:
Dataset identifier for the Datastore you are
connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If
file path the file must be readable.

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/datastore

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. See Google::Gax::CallSettings. Optional.

methods.name: debugger
title: Google
Cloud#debugger
methods.description:
Creates a new debugger object for instrumenting Stackdriver Debugger for an application. Each call creates a new debugger agent with independent connection service.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
debugger = gcloud.debugger

debugger.start

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
debugger = gcloud.debugger scope: platform_scope

params.name: service_name
params.description: Name for the debuggee application. Optional.

params.name: service_version
params.description:
Version identifier for the debuggee
application. Optional.

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud_debugger

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.

methods.name: debugger

Cloud.debugger

Creates a new debugger object for instrumenting Stackdriver Debugger for an application. Each call creates a new debugger agent with independent connection service.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

debugger.start

the credentials is used.

params.name: credentials

params.name: service_name
params.description: Name for the debuggee application. Optional.

params.name: service_version
params.description: Version identifier for the debuggee

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud_debugger

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.

methods.name: dns
title: Google
Cloud#dns
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the DNS service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.records.each do |record|
  puts record.name
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
dns_readonly = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readonly"
dns = gcloud.dns scope: dns_readonly

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readwrite

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 3. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: dns
title: Google
Cloud.dns
methods.description:
Creates a new Project instance connected to the DNS service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

dns = Google::Cloud.dns "my-project", "/path/to/keyfile.json"

zone = dns.zone "example-com"

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Identifier for a DNS project. If not present,
the default project for the credentials is used.

params.name: credentials
params.description: The path to the keyfile as a String, the contents of the keyfile as a Hash, or a Google::Auth::Credentials object. (See Dns::Credentials)

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readwrite

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 3. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: error_reporting
title: Google
Cloud#error_reporting
methods.description:
Create a new object for connecting to the Stackdriver Error Reporting service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/error_reporting"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new "GCP_Project_ID",
                           "/path/to/gcp/secretkey.json"
error_reporting = gcloud.error_reporting

error_event = error_reporting.error_event "Error with Backtrace",
                                          event_time: Time.now,
                                          service_name: "my_app_name",
                                          service_version: "v8"
error_reporting.report error_event

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.

methods.name: error_reporting
title: Google
Cloud.error_reporting
methods.description:
Create a new object for connecting to the Stackdriver Error Reporting service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/error_reporting"

error_reporting =
  Google::Cloud.error_reporting "GCP_Project_ID",
                                "/path/to/gcp/secretkey.json"

error_event = error_reporting.error_event "Error with Backtrace",
                                          event_time: Time.now,
                                          service_name: "my_app_name",
                                          service_version: "v8"
error_reporting.report error_event

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Google Cloud Platform project identifier for
the Stackdriver Error Reporting service you are connecting to. If not
present, the default project for the credentials is used.

params.name: credentials
params.description: The path to the keyfile as a String, the contents of the keyfile as a Hash, or a Google::Auth::Credentials object. (See ErrorReporting::Credentials)

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.

methods.name: logging
title: Google
Cloud#logging
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Stackdriver Logging service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

entries = logging.entries
entries.each do |e|
  puts "[#{e.timestamp}] #{e.log_name} #{e.payload.inspect}"
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
logging = gcloud.logging scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/logging.admin

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.

methods.name: resource_manager
title: Google
Cloud#resource_manager
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Resource Manager service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
resource_manager.projects.each do |project|
  puts projects.project_id
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
readonly_scope = \
  "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloudresourcemanager.readonly"
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager scope: readonly_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 3. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: trace
title: Google
Cloud#trace
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Stackdriver Trace service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
trace_client = gcloud.trace

traces = trace_client.list_traces Time.now - 3600, Time.now
traces.each do |trace|
  puts "Retrieved trace ID: #{trace.trace_id}"
end

params.name: scope
params.description: The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs. The default scope is https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: trace
title: Google
Cloud.trace
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Stackdriver Trace service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

trace_client = Google::Cloud.trace

traces = trace_client.list_traces Time.now - 3600, Time.now
traces.each do |trace|
  puts "Retrieved trace ID: #{trace.trace_id}"
end

params.name: project_id
params.description:
Project identifier for the Stackdriver Trace
service you are connecting to. If not present, the default project for
the credentials is used.

params.name: credentials
params.description: The path to the keyfile as a String, the contents of the keyfile as a Hash, or a Google::Auth::Credentials object. (See Trace::Credentials)

params.name: scope
params.description: The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs. The default scope is https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

methods.name: translate
title: Google
Cloud#translate
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Cloud Translation API. Each call creates a new connection.

Like other Cloud Platform services, Google Cloud Translation API supports authentication using a project ID and OAuth 2.0 credentials. In addition, it supports authentication using a public API access key. (If both the API key and the project and OAuth 2.0 credentials are provided, the API key will be used.) Instructions and configuration options are covered in the Authentication Guide.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
translate = gcloud.translate "api-key-abc123XYZ789"

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

examples.caption: Using API Key from the environment variable.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

ENV["TRANSLATE_KEY"] = "api-key-abc123XYZ789"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
translate = gcloud.translate

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

params.name: key
params.description: a public API access key (not an OAuth 2.0 token)

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of times to retry requests on server error. The default value is 3. Optional.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: project_id

Project identifier for the Cloud Translation
service you are connecting to. If not present, the default project for

params.name: keyfile
params.description: Alias for the credentials argument. Deprecated.

methods.name: vision
title: Google
Cloud#vision
methods.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Vision service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
vision = gcloud.vision

image = vision.image "path/to/landmark.jpg"

landmark = image.landmark
landmark.description #=> "Mount Rushmore"

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud  = Google::Cloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
vision = gcloud.vision scope: platform_scope

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scope is:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.
